qas.question: In what type of climate is New Delhi located?
Between which months do New Delhi's long summers last?
When does the monsoon season occur in New Delhi?
What is the annual mean temperature of New Delhi?
What is the highest ever recorded temperature in New Delhi?

context: The climate of New Delhi is a monsoon-influenced humid <a0_0>subtropical climate<a0_0/> (Köppen Cwa) with high variation between summer and winter in terms of both temperature and rainfall. The temperature varies from 46 °C (115 °F) in summers to around 0 °C (32 °F) in winters. The area's version of a humid subtropical climate is noticeably different from many other cities with this climate classification in that it features long and very hot summers, relatively dry and mild winters, a monsoonal period, and dust storms. Summers are long, extending from early <a1_0>April to October<a1_0/>, with the monsoon season occurring in <a2_0>the middle of the summer<a2_0/>. Winter starts in November and peaks in January. The annual mean temperature is around <a3_0>25 °C (77 °F)<a3_0/>; monthly daily mean temperatures range from approximately 14 to 34 °C (57 to 93 °F). New Delhi's highest temperature ever recorded is <a4_0>49.1 °C (120.4 °F)<a4_0/> while the lowest temperature ever recorded is −3.2 °C (26.2 °F). Those for Delhi metropolis stand at 49.9 °C (121.8 °F) and −3.2 °C (26.2 °F) respectively. The average annual rainfall is 784 millimetres (30.9 in), most of which is during the monsoons in July and August.
